body:
Ooh, that's interesting. We probably are just generating a JSON-stringified version of the configuration and embedding that into the config file.

I suspect this also applies to any other question (i.e., might ignore Windows/Unix line endings, might ignore indent settings, will preserve semicolon even if semicolons are stated not to be used, etc.).

I wonder if, for JavaScript configs only, we should just new up a CLIEngine instance and lint the config file (with that same file passed in as the config)? Seems like that could allow us to add more options to `eslint --init` in future without having to explicitly code for each option (i.e., no need to specifically write templates for single-quote vs double-quote, etc.).

I'll be curious to know what the rest of the team thinks.

Labeling as an "enhancement" for now under the assumption that this is not something we really designed for (i.e., current design = JSON.stringify or similar and we honestly didn't think about ensuring the JS config file would pass linting). Team: If I have that wrong, please relabel as needed. Thanks!
I agree, running the equivalent of `eslint --fix` on the config file before writing it to the filesystem seems like it would be useful.

Thanks for the quick response! I confirmed the behavior is the same with `eslint` `v4.17.0` (the output seems the same).

Running fix seems a clever way to handle this. Would this be a good task for someone new to the ESLint codebase to try and tackle?
I agree with `eslint --fix`. I did so when I wrote `--init` functionality on `eslint-cli`: https://github.com/eslint/eslint-cli/pull/5/files#diff-547d8fc032c76afa0bd0a4dde5206e3f

@SaladFork 

> Would this be a good task for someone new to the ESLint codebase to try and tackle?

Yes, I think it might be. I would suggest using CLIEngine, similar to what mysticatea described in [this comment](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/9947#issuecomment-363309514), to lint the generated config with itself and run autofix.

Very sorry for the delayed reply.
I'll champion this change, so it's now accepted.

issue.body:
Format newly generated .eslintrc.js file before it is saved.

**What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to item)**

[x] Other, please explain:

Slight improvement in the cli by addressing https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/9947

**What changes did you make? (Give an overview)**

When a user creates a new `.eslintrc.js` file via `eslint --init`, the resulting file conforms to the rules generated by the cli.

**Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?**

I could not figure out how to feature test this.

It is tested by implication: a unit test confirms that when a config file is written, if that file is a `.js` config file, and rules exist in the config that is being saved, then those rules are obeyed in the resulting file.

Also note: this change uses the `Linter` class under the hood instead of the `CLIEngine`. The latter cannot be imported by the `ConfigFile` class. I tried a little and decided it made more sense to reach straight to the `Linter` instead.

body: I'm gonna take a look at this for my first contribution.

issue.body:
<!--
    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://js.foundation/community/code-of-conduct).
-->

**What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to item)**

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/master/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofixing to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[ ] Add something to the core
[x] Other, please explain:

Update `--init` as described in #9947 
<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/contributing/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

**What changes did you make? (Give an overview)**
Updated the behavior of `--init` so generated JS config files follow linting rules. As described in #9947, this change makes `--init` run generated JS config files through the equivalent of `eslint --fix` to make sure they follow the selected linting rules.

**Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?**
This is my first contribution to ESLint, so let me know if I need to change anything! The only weird part about the code change is the `require` on line 293 to get `CLIEngine`. This require cannot be at the top of the file because of a circular dependency between `config-file.js` and `cli-engine.js`.
